documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: 389-ds:1.4 security update

note.text:
An update for the 389-ds:1.4 module is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 8.4 Extended Update Support.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Moderate. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
389 Directory Server is an LDAP version 3 (LDAPv3) compliant server. The base packages include the Lightweight Directory Access Protocol (LDAP) server and command-line utilities for server administration. 

Security Fix(es):

* 389-ds-base: SIGSEGV in sync_repl (CVE-2022-2850)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

acknowledgment.Description: This issue was discovered by Viktor Ashirov (Red Hat).
